pain_points_original.title: Ensuring AI Security and Regulatory Compliance
pain_points_original.description: The DPC must ensure any AI solution strictly complies with government ICT security, cyber policies, and Information Privacy Principles (IPPs). This is critical because they handle sensitive public data, and any breach could lead to significant legal, financial, and reputational damage across the state.

pain_points_original.title: Uncertainty of AI ROI and Adoption in Government
pain_points_original.description: The DPC needs to validate the real-world benefits of AI to justify investment and manage adoption risks before a large-scale rollout. The challenge is building a strong business case and proving that AI can genuinely enhance efficiency and public service delivery through low-risk pilot programs.

pain_points_original.title: Complex Integration with Existing Government Systems
pain_points_original.description: The DPC requires AI solutions that can be seamlessly integrated with its existing, diverse government IT infrastructure. The challenge lies in ensuring a new tool is adaptable and scalable without disrupting critical public services. A failure to integrate effectively would result in wasted public funds.

pain_points_original.title: Lack of Proven, Government-Context AI Solutions
pain_points_original.description: The DPC seeks AI solutions with a proven track record within the public sector, not just commercial environments. The challenge is identifying tools that understand the unique constraints, processes, and objectives of government. They aim to avoid common pitfalls by leveraging vendor experience.
